intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides var. aricense, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils at high altitudes. It has a taproot system and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
